thread.title: Hillsborough's Amankwaa's scoop and score keyed big win
thread.title_full: Hillsborough's Amankwaa's scoop and score keyed big win

title: Hillsborough's Amankwaa's scoop and score keyed big win
text:
Hillsborough's Amankwaa's scoop and score keyed big win Harry Frezza , @thefrez56 9:39 p.m. EDT October 19, 2015 CN Player of Week CONNECT 4 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
We will never know if Hillsborough would have lost its Mid-State 38 Delaware Division game at Union on Friday night if junior safety David Amankwaa hadn't picked up a fumble and returned it more than 90 yards for a touchdown. 
All that's certain is Union was trailing 9-6 early in the third quarter, but was set up with a first-and-10 at the Raiders' 12 when misfortune struck the Farmers. 
On the other side, they will tell you Amankwaa's play may have saved a quest to make the Central Group V playoffs. 
Amankwaa, who also had an interception on the third play of the game, is the Courier News Player of the Week. 
Amankwaa had returned an interception 22 yards to the Farmer's eight on the third play of the game, but the Raiders couldn't take advantage. 
Amankwaa's fumble return had an entirely different ending. 
The 5-foot-10, 190-pounder blitzed from the edge as senior Hayden Panagos pressured from inside forcing a bad exchange. 
"He picked it up and off he went," Hillsborough coach Kevin Carty said. 
The one hiccup on the play came when Amankwaa took a glance behind him just as he reached the Union 20. Carty said Amankwaa nearly tripped, but he regained balance to give the Raiders a 15-6 lead with Zachary Eilbacher's extra point making it 16-6. The Raiders went on to win 29-18 to keep their drive to make the Central Group V playoffs alive. 
"It was an awesome play and it was nice to have some breathing room," Carty said. 
The big return Amankwaa's second of the season. He returned an interception 50 yards for a score in the 42-0 win at Hunterdon Central. 
"He's becoming a real player for us and he's really just learning how to play the game,'' said Carty, pointing out sophomore defensive back 
Charles Amankwaa is David's brother. The Amankwaa's, Ryan Melillo and Luke Jansen make up the team's secondary. 
The Raiders (2-4) moved into seventh in the sectional field one spot ahead of Edison (2-3). The Raiders play host to Elizabeth (4-2) Friday night with the Minutemen out to bounce back from a 31-0 loss at Phillipsburg and fortify their spot in the North 2 Group V field. 
OTHER NOTABLE PLAYERS: 
Westfield senior back Jack Curry ran for 216 yards and four touchdowns on 38 carries in the Blue Devils 34-6 rout of Westfield in a battle of Mid State-38 Watchung Division unbeatens. Westfield is 5-0. 
Montgomery senior Mitch Chugunov caught nine passes for 146 yards and two touchdowns in a 26-6 win over Scotch Plains-Fanwood. 
Ridge senior back Kermit Hoffman ran for 114 yards and three touchdowns on 17 carries and caught four passes for 68 yards in a wild 43-32 win over Plainfield in Bernards. 
Somerville's Jeremiah Lynch caught an 81-yard touchdown pass from QB Mike Tarver, returned a kick 82 yards for a score and added a two point conversion run in a 26-20 victory over Summit. Read or Share this story: http://mycj.co/1LGXozN TOP VIDEOS
